title: Default to Permissioned Bounties
body:
### User Story

As a funder I want to have approval required as the default to avoid people squating my bounties.

### Why Is this Needed

People are squating permissionless bounties and not completing them.

### Description

Swap the order of permission types on the funder form.

title: Fix tip avatar not matching
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->
This use the same avatar as profiles when tipping a user by searching or linking from profiles 
Also fix the logic to pick the active avatar of the user to match the profile instead of the first one on the query results.
Example:
Is very confusing when you search some user to tip and the picture doesn't match with the one on profile, that make you feel insecure.

##### Testing

<!-- All PRs should be accompanied by tests! If you haven't added tests, please explain here. -->
locally testes with users and non users with base avatar and with just the GitHub image.

title: Add Sablier Tip Streaming
body:
# Description 
This PR adds support for Sablier Streaming to Gitcoin Tips which can be done through gitcoin.co/tips

# Work Done - 
 [x]  Has to work on mobile
 [x]  Has to work on `gitcoin.co`, `pay.sablier.finance` and `app.sablier.finance` as well, therefore you have to create the stream through the Payroll.sol proxy
 [ ]  If no address is on file for a profile, then no stream can be done, but the user can send an invite email to that user asking them what their eth address is

# Work Accomplished by this PR -

1. The stream can now be created from the Tips Page.
2. After the stream is created, the details are updated in the gitcoin backend.
3. Because of that the stream details (Stream Link) is sent to the User Notifications, Email as well as it is updated to Gitcoin Activity.

# Future Work to be done -
1. Add support for better backend to update Sablier Tip Link when the stream is created.
2. Use `CREATE2` features to create a stream when a user does not have any account so it can be redeem later

Few Screenshots of the whole process :- https://imgur.com/a/irdbnUn

title: Add support for tipping using Sablier
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->

This PR is part of the Sustain Web3 hackathon. It adds a toggle to existing gitcoin.co/tip flow to allow users to toggle between legacy tips and stream tips using Sablier

##### What it solves so far:

- [X] Has to work on mobile
- [X] Has to work on `gitcoin.co`, `pay.sablier.finance` and `app.sablier.finance` as well, therefore you have to create the stream through the Payroll.sol proxy
- [X] If no address is on file for a profile, then no stream can be done, but the user can send an invite email to that user asking them what their eth address is

##### TODO/Features that should be implemented in the future:

- Validate CompoundTokens
- Update the `Tip` table schema to add some metadata about the streaming when calling methods `tip/send/3` or `tip/send/4`
- Update metadata on email sent when tip is created so recipient receives an URL (`app.sablier.finance/stream/XX`) where he can redeem the streamed tip. Right now, this URL is specified through the UI after the stream is created
- Use `CREATE2` features to create a stream when a user does not have any account so it can be redeem later

##### Video Demo

[Watch it here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA8SKTG1Qfo&feature=youtu.be)

##### Other Remakrs

This code was tested on the Rinkeby testnet. Take into account the following steps when testing this implementation:

- Go to the [admin](https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_setup/#add-a-custom-erc20-token-to-your-local-gitcoin) console and update the DAI token address on Rinkeby to `0xc3dbf84abb494ce5199d5d4d815b10ec29529ff8` 
- Mint yourself some TestnetDAI using [etherscan](https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/token/0xc3dbf84abb494ce5199d5d4d815b10ec29529ff8)
- Follow the [official docs](https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_third_party_integrations/#setup-sendgrid-to-send-emails-recommended) to config `SendGrid` and enable sending emails in your local Gitcoin deployment

##### Refers/Fixes

<!-- If this PR is related to a Github issue, please add a link here. -->
Refs: https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5914

title: use gnosis tech to get down to 1 tx for gitcoin grants contribs
body:
Hey. I know I mentioned this to you on twitter but wanted to officially pass it along. I think Gitcoin could really benefit from leveraging the safe because it’d allow you to batch all the txs. We recently launched our Safe Proxy SDK which allows you to deploy it behind the scenes of metamask for users. We have a lot of teams leveraging it now (pepo, universal logins for some examples). We will have a dev dashboard for this soon but for now it’s at: https://github.com/gnosis/contract-proxy-kit

we are launching a new prediction market platform soon (please keep here) that you can see an alpha of at REDACTED and we are leveraging it. So basically to create a market or bet, there’s just 1 tx (after the first approval) and it batches it all. Example tx:

https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/tx/0xee6b52c05f09dc8bc7fd5e71962b0f184203996945714fb17277981498fd16d5

title: Quests Round 3 Winners
Bundle multiple contributions  via DeFiZap.
body:
### User Story

As a contributor to multiple Gitcoin grants, I want to contribute in a 'Zap' to avoid multiple on-chain transactions.

### Why Is this Needed

Observing UX around Gitcoin contributions, especially during Gitcoin Grants CLR matching rounds, many supporters are contributing to multiple projects. Taking a clear example from [Chric Blec's video](https://twitter.com/ChrisBlec/status/1215734396889620480?s=20), immediate observation is 50% of the time is spent initiating and waiting for separate contribution transactions to confirm. DeFiZap could help supporters anytime they are contributing to 2 or more projects. In addition, CLR matching amounts could be efficiently deployed deployed across grantees (even streamed over time by also plugging Sablier).

### Description

*Type*: Feature

### Current Behavior
Select project 1 - > choose amount -> confirm transactions.
Select project 2 - > choose amount -> confirm transactions.
Select project 3. - > choose amount -> confirm transactions.
[Video.](https://twitter.com/ChrisBlec/status/1215734396889620480?s=20)

### Expected Behavior
Select Project 1,2,3, etc.- > choose amount -> choose allocations(or even split) -> confirm transactions.

### Definition of Done


### Additional Information
- Do we want to enable contributions in any token or just limit to one? 
- Do projects want incoming contributions to be auto-deployed to chosen, yield generating opportunities in DeFi? E.g. wrapped into CHAI or LP on Uniswap.

title: Redeeing eth1xlivestream2020 kudos is not working for some people?
body:
<sub>I remain uncertain as to how to best describe what is happening but it appears that transactions for redeeming https://gitcoin.co/kudos/redeem/eth1xlivestream2020 is going through -or hanging?- for at least two people. gitcoin.co/ililic -if I am unmistaken- and myself.</sup>

After a couple hours of having redeemed the eth1xlivestream2020 kudos, I am unable to see any changes on etherscan and on the kudos page it appears that, while gitcoin has seemed to have registered all the redeems via the Activity, the marketplace states [(on this page)](https://gitcoin.co/kudos/4033/i_want_you_to_build_on_eth), while they increase, always seem to be behind by some number. 

I have observed that the "Total Minted" has been consitantly two behind when it registered at eight, ten, and then now -at current time of writing- twelve:

![1111](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1489224/74067166-988dbf00-49c6-11ea-92ff-c838cb108120.png)

title: Profile Backup to 3box is Failing

It would also seem that when attempting tot POST to `api/v0.1/profile/backup`, a 500 response is given. The recieved response is:

title: Add Authereum Support
body:
Integrating [Authereum](http://authereum.com/) will allow users to use Gitcoin with free transactions. New users can sign up in seconds and won't be required to download anything. Also, users can purchase DAI instantly with a debit card and can contribute to grants without needing ETH in their wallet.

More information on integration can be found here: http://docs.authereum.com/
If you're considering supporting multiple non-injected wallet providers, I'd recommend looking into one of the following solutions:
https://www.blocknative.com/onboard
https://github.com/NoahZinsmeister/web3-react (best for custom UIs)
https://github.com/web3connect/web3connect

The scope of this bounty is to integrate Authereum into Gitcoin

The winning submission for this bounty will have integrated Authereum into Gitcoin and will have tested locally
1. Send Tip
1. Receive Tip
1. Create Bounty 
1. Payout Bounty
1. Submit Bounty
1. Create Grant
1. Fund Grant
1. Send Kudos
1. Receive Kudos

on Google Chrome without Metamask.  Additionally we would like to have the following browsers tested (albeit with a lighter test footprint)
1. Brave
2. Safari
3. Edge

The winning submission will have updated all references to Metamask to 'Your Web3 Wallet'

The winning submission must be complete within 2 weeks of worker acceptance.

body:

title: Give feedback when grant owners use the 'email funders' feature
body:
<!--
Hello Gitcoiner!

Please use the template below for feature requests for Gitcoin.
If it is general support you need, reach out to us at
gitcoin.co/slack

-->

### User Story

[comment]: # (As a <user type>, I want to <task> so that <goal>.)
As a grant owner, when I click `email funders` I want to get a message that says if the frunders were emailed correctly

### Why Is this Needed

[comment]: # (Describe the problem and why this task is needed. Provide description of the current state, what you would like to happen, and what actually happen)
*Summary*: When grant owners decide to email funders, they don't get a success/error message and thus they might click the button multiple times which might send the mail multiple times. We don't want to spam users.

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Feature

### Current Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
When grant owners click the email funders button, they don't get an error/success message

### Expected Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
Give me a success/error message

### Definition of Done
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, bullets are helpful.)

### Data Requirements
[comment]: # (How will we measure the success of this feature? What kind of tracking is needed for this feature (clicks, impressions, flag)?)

### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, content, screenshots, etc.)

*Summary*: I would like to get the answers to my post in my notifications without having to surf all the town square or having to look at my e-mail

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Feature

### Current Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
There is no notification for town square related activity

### Expected Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
Get notifications from someone pinging me in the town square or for responses to my post

title: mini CLR rounds on newsfeed - READY FOR REVIEW
body: ##### Description This is what this looks like: The bones are done done: - [X] mechanisms to create /schedule match rounds - [X] mechanisms to continually refresh match rankings - [X] mechanism to automatically make a CLR payout - [X] mechanism to follow users straight on newsfeed Still gotta put the finishing touches on here: - [x] show CLR estimates on newsfeed items (not just leaderboard) - [x] make estimates refresh when new tip is made (either ajax or fresh) - [x] make tips non alpha - [ ] a TLDR how it works module (need help from design) - [ ] what do we do with the follow data? do we highlight it into the various tab types? - [x] follow buttons everywhere on newsfeed - [x] create Earnings, newsfeed items, email when payout happys. celebrate it! ##### Refers/Fixes https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5941 ##### Testing tested locally should be merged along with https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/pull/5916/

title: DESIGN - mini CLR round module
body:
hey design frands,

here is a mock of a weekly mini CLR mechanism for the gitcoin town square

https://bits.owocki.com/7KuyOYPo

the idea is that we do weekly CLR rounds for micro-tips on the newsfeed. this accomplishes several things for us:
a) relieves the pressure to send big tips, and makes the micro-tips into a big value add/significant $$$
b) creates an economic force that rewards good value-add answers to questions posted. (this fits really neatly into @Dan Lipert’s vision of a crypto enabled stack overflow)
c) is a casual, quick, iterative way to test concepts for real Gitcoin Grants CLR Rounds.
d) keeps users coming back to town square WoW + making them actively micro-transact with each other

im not married to doing this.. i think its a little outlandish.. but i also think its got pretty high upside for the above reasons.  apparently so does the twitter hivemind https://twitter.com/owocki/status/1224042348335644672

so what do i need from you?
do you think this is an awful idea?  a great idea? a meh idea.. let me know
if we agree its worth pursuing, then can i get a design rev on the top right module from a designer? (ideally that fits in the new town square design)
@fronk has already given me his CLR script, and its working great.  i can provide real time CLR estimates for new tips which i think is pretty incredible.

title: I can't start work on a gitcoin bounty
body:
I get this message when I try to click "Express interest" on a gitcoin bounty.

"Because a staff member has had to remove you from a bounty in the past, you are unable to startmore work at this time. Please leave a message on slack if you feel this message is in error."

Desktop imac mac os. Google Chrome. Version 79.0.3945.130
